intro: Cornutia longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved cornutia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Chile and Argentina. The plant is characterized by its slender, evergreen shrubs with elongated, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, bell-shaped, and typically pink or white, arranged in clusters. Cornutia longifolia is adapted to grow in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in humid, temperate climates.
